Reviews.Title: Wow! What a relief!
Reviews.Author: Georgia Mom
Reviews.Content: I am so happy I was able to order this Windows & laptop.  I had first ordered from Costco a Toshiba that had every bell and whistle and was lightning quick.  It should have a been a dream.  However, it was made nearly unusable by Windows 8 and I wisely decided to return it.  I went on the hunt for a Windows 7 laptop and found this one.  I was a bit skeptical about how the description mentions Windows 8, but while reading other reviews I gained confidence in placing the order and am so happy I did.The computer arrived quickly and is everything I hoped it would be.  I am no super techie but this laptop is fast.  Applications open quickly and surfing the net is lightning fast over wireless.Some things I really love about this computer are:1) It is not loaded down with Bloat-ware2) I also love having the buttons above the mousepad3) It also has an HDMI outlet in case you want to hook it to a TV or something4) It comes with Windows 7 pre-installed but they send you Windows 8 recovery disc5) The screen is gorgeous and looks like it is anti-glare6) The speakers sound nice to me7) It has a web cam8) It has a DVD reader/writer (not blue ray but I don't care)Quite frankly I wish I had the funds available to buy an additional one.  It seems like everyone in the house needs use of a computer at the same time and having one more would solve some problems.  Overall, both myself and my husband are very happy with this purchase.  Like he said "Wow, this is smoking fast!"  If you are looking for a quick little workhorse then you really can't go wrong.  Plus having Windows 7 will make you way happier than that mess that they call Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Great, fast, thinkpad...
Reviews.Author: Sebatian Lapitz
Reviews.Content: Purchased this laptop for my mother and it’s perfect. She is very clumsy and careless so I was looking more for something resistant, reliable and with good quality than fashionable, chic or lightweight.The CPU, the AMD APU A4 is much better than Intel counter parts, Celeron, Dual Cores and even some Core i3. It comes with windows 7, so I didn’t waste time trying to teach my mother how to use the useless tiles (Metro) and all the pointless changes in windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Really great laptop.
Reviews.Author: NewShoes! "Avid listener"
Reviews.Content: Wellll, have had it since the end of June, annnnd -  very solid build quality, responsive, was easy to set up, and is easy to start up, LOVE the non glare display, much better sound system than any laptop I 've had before, good battery life, no glitches so far. If anything else comes to mind, I will get right back here ; }Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great computer for its price
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing product. The processor is much better than I thought. It's fast and good designed. Really good!

Reviews.Title: Great Machine; fast delivery
Reviews.Author: MikeyMike
Reviews.Content: This is an attractive machine, with TrackPoint (a must have for me) at a great price.  It came with Windows 7 installed and Windows 8 upgrade discs.  Although I selected the free shipping option, it arrived in 2 days via FedEx.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop for the Price
Reviews.Author: Kalyan Mondal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like it for being a robust laptop. It just is little heavyweight and little larger than what we expected.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied-great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Lynn S. "Badger Fan"
Reviews.Content: This was only my second laptop purchase in the past 5 years.  My son helped me choose this one due to its price (I did not not want to spend a lot) and what it offered (size/weight/resolution/battery life, etc).  My 'soft' review follows.Pros:1.  Light and comfortable on my lap since it does not get uncomfortably warm.2.  Keys are solid and respond well.3.  Mouse pad works perfectly and very responsive.4.  Speakers are positioned on the front facing the user and have great sound.5.  TrackPoint takes getting used to and I am not sure if I will use it.6.  Has Windows 7.7.  Programs load fast.8.  When closed the top has a dull matted finish that looks great.9.  Free shipping.Cons:None so far.  I have had this for approximately one month and I am very satisfied.  I would purchase again.  Even my son, who has a high level of computer knowledge, is impressed with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: All three USB ports on the left side stopped working less than one month after I received!
Reviews.Author: cathy gammon
Reviews.Content: I am trying to get some help with this now.  I bought this computer for work and need to use those hubs for headphone and foot pedal.  One month of use is all I got out of them!  I searched and searched Lenovo's support site and can find no solution.UPDATE:  Amazon came through and in less than one day!  This is the message I received from Amazon -Hello,I am really sorry to know about the problem you facing with your order of  ThinkPad Edge E535 3260EDU 15.6" LED Notebook - AMD - A-Series A4-4300M 2.5GHz  as the ports are not working. We truly did not expect this would happen. We regret the inconvenience caused.I am sorry to know that the manufacturer could not help you.I've checked your order and see the item was ordered from Computer Upgrade King, a seller on our website. Because seller's inventory is constantly changing, we can't replace items sold by them that are Fulfilled by Amazon.In this case I have following option for you :1. If you are willing to keep the item and fix it locally, we will issue a refund of $100 to you2. You can return the item for full refund.3. You can place a new order and let us know the order number and we will issue promotional certificate for the shipping charges.Please let us know which option you choose.One of our aims at Amazon.com is to provide a convenient and efficient service; in this case, we haven't met that standard. I'm truly sorry, and I hope you'll give us another chance in the future.I hope this information helps. We look forward to your reply.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo laptops are the best
Reviews.Author: Stevie B.
Reviews.Content: My wife had a Lenovo at work for many years and loves the little TrackPoint "joystick" in the middle of the keyboard.  When she was laid off, I got her a Dell laptop and it was really flimsy.  I finally donated it to a charity and bought her this one.  She couldn't be happier.  It just feel solid and well built.  Personally, I love that it came with Window 8 upgradable to Windows 8.  As the household computer administrator, I have no interest in learning a new operating system at this time.

Reviews.Title: Great business-level laptop
Reviews.Author: Mark Edward Soper "Mark Edward Soper"
Reviews.Content: This laptop combines great business-level features including the legendary IBM/Lenovo TrackPoint pointing stick (as well as a touch pad), great keyboard, and good speed.

Reviews.Title: Beware Lenovo
Reviews.Author: George D "georgied"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a TP Edge in Nov 2011. Last week it went dead and would not power up. Nothing, no charging lights or any other sign of life. Went through the trouble shooting procedure and finally ended up on Lenovo's web forum. Wow! Story after story of the same failure traced to a bad EEPROM on the motherboard. Story after story of how Lenovo walked away from this issue and left everyone hanging if their machine was out of warranty. This is what is known in the industry as a "catastrophic failure". Despite the lack of satisfaction reported by the posts of the web site, I called anyway. First, they would not acknowledge there was a problem. The tech sidestepped the issue completely. Second, they wouldn't do a thing w/o a $500.00 deposit which is about what I paid for the product to start with. These failures are the fault of the component provider but it is Lenovo's responsibility to make it good. Their tech support and customer service is as bad as it gets. This month's Consumer Reports pretty much confirms it. So, if your considering a Lenovo product, make sure you are prepared to treat it as a "Throw Away" if it breaks. I am moving to Apple. They cost a good bit more but Apple stands behind their products and Apple also has the lowest repair frequency of any other computer manufacturer. I am tired of spending my good money and then be treated like a chump.

Reviews.Title: Windows 7 Yay!
Reviews.Author: Monica Senius
Reviews.Content: I am so glad to have found a Win 7 laptop.  There was absolutely no bloatware (other than Lenovo products.)  It was basically plug n' play.  Wakes up fast.  It has a 10 key number pad that was a bonus as I've come to not expect this feature on laptops.I bought this less than a month ago.  The only issue I had was the display brightness level went down to zero when plugged in.  Nothing seemed to fix it so I re-booted and the problem went away and hasn't happened again.

Reviews.Title: A reasonably priced laptop with the Trackpoint
Reviews.Author: Sven Kurbel "Rayov"
Reviews.Content: It is a very practical and reasonably priced laptop. More memory needs to be added, but the screen is fine.The big plus is the Trackpoint that allows precise cursor navigation and undisturbed typing when You turn the touchpad off, even on buses and in other tight spaces. A must for people that do not want to carry a mouse around.

Reviews.Title: ThinkPad Edge E535
Reviews.Author: William L. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I've owned many computers in the past 25 years, but this was by far the most unreliable and problematic. It finally stopped working altogether after 7 months of very light use in my part time office.  During it's brief lifetime it was constantly plagued by intermittent failures of the USB ports.  I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Not a good choice
Reviews.Author: Robert S.
Reviews.Content: The seller of the laptop was good.  Rating is based on the laptop itself and Lenovo technical support. The first one I received was faulty--the WiFi did not work.  Took it to the tech people at work who confirmed the WiFi was faulty.  To be sure, they got it online using a dongle and updated all drivers and other software--there was a lot to update.  Then contacted Lenovo support.  The first tech I talked with attributed the problem to something that was not even remotely plausible.  He was an idiot.  The second one I talked with was rude and just kept saying the only choice I had was to send it back to Lenovo.  Contacted the seller who had me return it to them, but let me order another one first so I would not be without a computer.  I was using the first one with the dongle from work.  the reorder was smooth and I got the replacement machine in a timely basis. However it was faulty also.  The WiFi worked as it was supposed to, but the screen would suddenly go dark after a few uses--totally black when plugged in, almost too dark to read when not plugged in.  Contacted Lenovo again.  This person took me through several software updates, after which it seemed to work.  However, I soon discovered it was only because I rebooted.  Now must reboot every few times I use it when the screen goes black.  Will contact Lenovo again once I have another computer to use as I know I will have to return to them.  I would not buy another Lenovo product because of poor quality and terrible tech support.  I was going to get a Lenovo Yoga Pro as my carry-around, but now will not.  Will get Surface Pro or ASUS Trio instead.  Buying this laptop was a poor choice.  I have owned several Toshiba laptops and never ran into quality issues or unknowledgeable and rude tech support people.  Buyer beware--don't make the mistake I did.

Reviews.Title: I am happy with my Lenovo Think-Pad laptop
Reviews.Author: Judith A McNea
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews before purchasing this laptop, as my Toshiba's DVD player stopped working and the speakers did not work when on line after not even three years.  It has excellent speakers and performs very well.  I have had it now for three months and  am hoping it lasts for a good long while.

Reviews.Title: It works but it doesn't hold a charge very well.
Reviews.Author: Brian L. Leichty
Reviews.Content: For what I need to use this laptop for, it is a good computer.  However, if I try to use it without it being plugged-in, it doesn't stay charged for very long, maybe a few hours if I'm lucky.  So I leave it plugged in.

Reviews.Title: Hate it
Reviews.Author: Calypso
Reviews.Content: Piece of junk. I wanted to return it the day I got, but I did not want to pay for shipping + $75 restocking fee. My system is already slow, the battery stops charging all of a sudden, the video and audio are sub-par. And its only 2 months old! I'm waiting till I can save up enough money to buy a Macbook.

Reviews.Title: good quality of laptop in general
Reviews.Author: Giada Aprea
Reviews.Content: I read some feedback about this laptop, before buying it, and the most of them were saying that the touchpad was too sensible.I can definitively say that it's not true.Very good quality for the video and audio

Reviews.Title: Large Screen, Lots of Space
Reviews.Author: YuBalance
Reviews.Content: I use this to run my small business and it is definitely getting the job done. I ordered mine with Windows 8 Professional, MS Office Professional, Quickbooks and Norton Anti-Virus pre-installed for under $1,200.  It would have been the same price, if not more expensive, to get an Apple with nothing pre-installed.  I also have an Adobe Creative Suite on this computer and everything is still running well, even though the software takes up a lot of space.  My only complaint is the keyboard is set back about 4-5 inches and it strains my wrists to move the mouse (I am always on my smartphone, and have developed thumb, wrist and forearm problems).  I had to get a wireless mouse because it literally hurts me to use the red dot or the mouse that come on the computer.  Definitely get a wireless mouse with this computer!!  As a side note, the oil from your hands is noticeable on the exterior of the computer.  It doesn't bother me because it wipes off easily, but I'm sure could really get to some people.

Reviews.Title: On the fence
Reviews.Author: Kristian Adams
Reviews.Content: It's ok. Too big and heavy. Not as fast as I had hope does all the basic though. It's just an alright laptop

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Laptop! Happy with it.
Reviews.Author: K. A. Henson
Reviews.Content: Nice Machine! Very happy with this Thinkpad. I haven't had it long enough to really test it, but it's really nice. The feel of the keyboard and the touchpad is GREAT.  And it even has the "magic nubbin" Trackpoint.  The screen is nice- BIG!Like others have said, not much bloatware. Just the Lenovo programs and 30 day Norton trial.  The top lid is a rubberized wraparound type. Nice. And the plastic on the keyboard areas is textured- nice feel to it. This laptop is CONSIDERABLY lighter in weight than the same size older Gateway beast that it is replacing. Took it apart to put in a larger hard drive - nice sturdy layout inside. When I load my graphics programs and audio programs, that will be the real test. Good buy!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: tjcj341
Reviews.Content: Super fast. light and appears to be well made. I was happy to find this computer with the Win 7 OS.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Jean Lau
Reviews.Content: So far no problem. I am very pleased with this purchase. I have a Thinkpad T430 at work and that is why I chose this PC.

Reviews.Title: It Just Works - Nothing Special
Reviews.Author: Tim Kaney
Reviews.Content: Pros - Easy to Use, Set-Up, and get working on it. Not many frivolous apps and / or programs needing to be wiped.Cons - Has some issues with BSOD when USB 2.0 peripherals are plugged into the USB 3.0 ports, which are not clearly labeled. Not super fast, but gets the job done for the average user. The antiquated orange thumb-stick confuses most modern users and it makes them scared of it.Overall - Decent, it works, not slow, nice. Nothing special, but seems reliable. Plus, it is an affordable Windows Prof. machine.

Reviews.Title: Buy big or go home
Reviews.Author: Scott Merkel
Reviews.Content: A reasonable rule of thumb is to buy the biggest / best you can afford. Lenovo really makes a fine product; nice screen, comfy keyboard, and enough memory to keep things quick. It was shipped quickly, and arrived ahead of the promised date. The cover is a rubberized, non-gloss which still looks as nice as the day it arrived.
